column4: there were couple of commands in F1 but nonwork they all installed the gnome...
ubuntu is more of a desktop o/s, as far as i can see.  for your server, have you considered using debian?
this installs quite happily without the gui
and without openoffice, evolution, etc, etc
and you can still use apt-get, and aptitude to install
thank yoiu for the advice...I wanted to install ubuntu because I felt really compfy with it... and learned alot about tlinux from it.... But I guess debian will have similare command right?
